page.title: 19ECOLOGY OF THE WEM BROOK
page.content: The Wem Brook flows from south to north through our area before joining the River Anker. In the south of our area the Wem Brook is very narrow as it is very near its source. It wends through farmland for much of its course. It is possible to follow the brook and even cross it by footbridge for much of its course as a public footpath runs by it. In places there is a great variety of wild plant life on its banks. As the brook nears its confluence with the Anker it flows through The Pingles Sports Complex. We worked out the rate of flow of the brook as it went through The Pingles- it was 9,000 litres per minute. Many different trees grow on the banks of The Wem. These are some Elderbery ,Sycamore ,Weeping Willow, Alder,Hawthorn, Ash and Horse Chestnut.
